meanings.definition: The quality or state of being transparent.
meanings.sent1: The transparence of the glass allowed us to see through it easily.
meanings.sent2: The transparence of the water made it possible to spot the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the transparence of the curtain to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty had a transparence that made it impossible to doubt her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The transparence of the ice sculpture created a stunning visual effect at the party.

meanings.definition: The ability to see through or perceive clearly.
meanings.sent1: His keen transparence of character allowed him to see through people's intentions.
meanings.sent2: The transparence of the telescope lens enabled a clear view of the distant stars.
meanings.sent3: The detective's transparence in solving cases made him a legend in the city.
meanings.sent4: The transparence of her emotions was evident in her expressive eyes.
meanings.sent5: The transparence of the diamond revealed its flawless beauty under the light.

meanings.definition: Clarity or lucidity in expression or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The transparence of his explanation left no room for confusion.
meanings.sent2: The transparence of her writing style made the complex topic easy to comprehend.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's transparence in jokes always brought laughter to the audience.

meanings.sent5: The transparence of the map helped us navigate through the unfamiliar terrain.
